segment.source: Turn on local user control and logging for Enterprise Mode.
segment.target: Turn on local user control and logging for Enterprise Mode.

segment.source: Turn on local control and logging for Enterprise Mode (Internet Explorer 11 for IT Pros)
segment.target: Turn on local control and logging for Enterprise Mode (Internet Explorer 11 for IT Pros)

segment.source: Turn on local control and logging for Enterprise Mode
segment.target: Turn on local control and logging for Enterprise Mode

segment.source: Applies to:
segment.target: Applies to:

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Windows 8.1
segment.target: Windows 8.1

segment.source: Windows 7
segment.target: Windows 7

segment.source: Windows Server 2012 R2
segment.target: Windows Server 2012 R2

segment.source: Windows Server 2008 R2 with Service Pack 1 (SP1)
segment.target: Windows Server 2008 R2 with Service Pack 1 (SP1)

segment.source: You can turn on local control of Enterprise Mode so that your users can turn Enterprise Mode on from the Tools menu.
segment.target: You can turn on local control of Enterprise Mode so that your users can turn Enterprise Mode on from the Tools menu.

segment.source: Turning on this feature also adds the Enterprise browser profile to the Emulation tab of the F12 developer tools.
segment.target: Turning on this feature also adds the Enterprise browser profile to the Emulation tab of the F12 developer tools.

segment.source: Besides turning on this feature, you also have the option to provide a URL for Enterprise Mode logging.
segment.target: Besides turning on this feature, you also have the option to provide a URL for Enterprise Mode logging.

segment.source: If you turn logging on, Internet Explorer initiates a simple POST back to the supplied address, including the URL and a specification that EnterpriseMode was turned on or off through the Tools menu.
segment.target: If you turn logging on, Internet Explorer initiates a simple POST back to the supplied address, including the URL and a specification that EnterpriseMode was turned on or off through the Tools menu.

segment.source: To turn on local control of Enterprise Mode using Group Policy
segment.target: To turn on local control of Enterprise Mode using Group Policy

segment.source: Open your Group Policy editor and go to the Administrative TemplatesWindows ComponentsInternet ExplorerLet users turn on and use Enterprise Mode from the Tools menu setting.
segment.target: Open your Group Policy editor and go to the Administrative TemplatesWindows ComponentsInternet ExplorerLet users turn on and use Enterprise Mode from the Tools menu setting.

segment.source: group policy editor with emie setting
segment.target: group policy editor with emie setting

segment.source: Click Enabled, and then in the Options area, type the location for where to receive reports about when your employees use this functionality to turn Enterprise Mode on or off from the Tools menu.
segment.target: Click Enabled, and then in the Options area, type the location for where to receive reports about when your employees use this functionality to turn Enterprise Mode on or off from the Tools menu.

segment.source: To turn on local control of Enterprise Mode using the registry
segment.target: To turn on local control of Enterprise Mode using the registry

segment.source: Open a registry editor, like regedit.exe and go to .
segment.target: Open a registry editor, like regedit.exe and go to .

segment.source: In the right pane, right-click and click New, click String Value, and then name the new value Enable.
segment.target: In the right pane, right-click and click New, click String Value, and then name the new value Enable.

segment.source: Right-click the Enable key, click Modify, and then type a Value data to point to a server that you can listen to for updates.
segment.target: Right-click the Enable key, click Modify, and then type a Value data to point to a server that you can listen to for updates.

segment.source: edit registry string for data collection location
segment.target: edit registry string for data collection location

segment.source: Your Value data location can be any of the following types:
segment.target: Your Value data location can be any of the following types:

segment.source: URL location (like, http://www.emieposturl.com/api/records or http://localhost:13000).
segment.target: URL location (like, http://www.emieposturl.com/api/records or http://localhost:13000).

segment.source: IE sends a POST message to the URL every time a change is made to Enterprise Mode from the Tools menu.
segment.target: IE sends a POST message to the URL every time a change is made to Enterprise Mode from the Tools menu.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: The example will only work if you’ve downloaded the sample discussed in the Set up Enterprise Mode logging and data collection topic.
segment.target: The example will only work if you’ve downloaded the sample discussed in the Set up Enterprise Mode logging and data collection topic.

segment.source: If you don’t have the sample, you won’t have the web API.
segment.target: If you don’t have the sample, you won’t have the web API.

segment.source: Local network location (like, http://emieposturl/). IE sends a POST message to your specified local network location every time a change is made to Enterprise Mode from the Tools** menu.
segment.target: Local network location (like, http://emieposturl/). IE sends a POST message to your specified local network location every time a change is made to Enterprise Mode from the Tools** menu.

segment.source: Empty string.
segment.target: Empty string.

segment.source: If you leave the Value data box blank; your employees will be able to turn Enterprise Mode on and off from the Tools menu, but you won’t collect any logging data.
segment.target: If you leave the Value data box blank; your employees will be able to turn Enterprise Mode on and off from the Tools menu, but you won’t collect any logging data.

segment.source: For information about how to collect the data provided when your employees turn Enterprise Mode on or off from the Tools menu, see Set up Enterprise Mode logging and data collection.
segment.target: For information about how to collect the data provided when your employees turn Enterprise Mode on or off from the Tools menu, see Set up Enterprise Mode logging and data collection.
